title-group.article-title: The Impact of Competitive Tendering on the Costs of Hospital Domestic Services

p.mixed-citation: For a discussion of the assumptions incorporated in this formulation, see Dornberger, Meadowcroft and Thompson (1986).
Hospitals that issued contracts for only part of the year are classified as non-tendered because they will have recorded only some fraction of the annual cost savings.
The coefficient on COMP1 indicates that for such hospitals, costs are a proportion given by e 0,1 of the costs incurred by other hospitals.

Heteroskedasticity arises whenever the variance of the disturbance term is not uniform across the sample. For details of tests for heteroskedasticity and the construction of appropriate weights see Judge et al. (1985, Chapter 11).
